topics.title: Personal Introduction and Mining Background
topics.summary: Arohbe introduces himself as former GetBlok team member and mining enthusiast. He explains his passion for decentralized mining and concerns about centralized mining software and pool servers.

topics.title: Cortex Project Concept and AI Integration Goals
topics.summary: Arohbe explains the original concept for Cortex, focusing on using AI to analyze GPU mining parameters. The goal is to train models on temperature, overclock settings, and performance data to optimize mining efficiency.

topics.title: Cortex Overview and Core Features
topics.summary: Cortex is introduced as an open-source CUDA GPU miner for Ergo with AI-generated code. Key features include real-time GPU control, stratum and node mining support, and AI-powered nonce prediction for mining optimization.

topics.title: Project Goals and Technical Architecture
topics.summary: Arohbe outlines project goals including node deployment, testnet block mining, and auto GPU tuning. He describes the architecture using Node.js, Express, React frontend, and discusses challenges with pool mining implementation.

topics.title: Node Manager and Miner UI Demo
topics.summary: Demo of the node manager interface for deploying Ergo nodes on mainnet or testnet with live configuration control. Shows miner manager UI for connecting to mining pools, specifically Sigmanauts pool integration.

topics.title: AI Integration Framework and Machine Learning Model
topics.summary: Details the AI framework using random forest machine learning model to analyze mining and GPU data. The system creates decision trees from JSON logs to predict nonce ranges with confidence scores for mining optimization.

topics.title: Project Progress Summary and Technical Challenges
topics.summary: Reviews completed features including node manager, GPU monitoring, and CUDA kernel development. Discusses ongoing challenges with share submission to pools and Linux GPU overclocking limitations.

topics.title: Live Code Demo and Backend Architecture
topics.summary: Live demonstration of building and running the Cortex codebase from backend to frontend. Shows miner connection to stratum pool, AI listener in Python, and training model execution with data analysis.

topics.title: Frontend UI Demo and Node Deployment
topics.summary: Live demo of the React frontend interface showing node manager deployment with version selection and configuration. Demonstrates mining dashboard setup with Ergo address and worker configuration for pool mining.

topics.title: GPU Monitoring and AI Insights Demo
topics.summary: Shows GPU monitoring interface with live temperature, utilization, and power data. Demonstrates AI insights page with limited dataset and discusses potential for GPU setting optimization rather than nonce prediction.

topics.title: Project Conclusion and Community Collaboration
topics.summary: Arohbe concludes by thanking viewers and emphasizing the open-source nature of Cortex. He invites community collaboration and contributions to expand the project, highlighting its community-driven purpose.
